Description: ASTRA: -If a person survives for six months, he will receive money, if not, he will receive nothing.- The Russian military is paid several times less than promised, while they are forced to storm positions in Ukraine with injuries. Also, for injury, ex-prisoners were entitled to a one-time payment of 50,000 rubles. up to 300,000 rubles, while for ordinary military personnel - 3 million rubles. based on the fact of injury and an additional 3 million in the case where the injury led to dismissal from the service. Description: ASTRA: The suspect in the assassination attempt on Zakhar Prilepin confessed, claims channel 112, owned by the Kremlin Ren-TV. -The man said that he was recruited by one of the Ukrainian special services several years ago. The accused of the attempt on the life of Zakhar Prilepin is demanded to be sentenced to life imprisonmentAbout this writes -Mediazona- with reference to a correspondent from the hall of the 2nd Western District Military Court.The investigation claims that the accused Alexander Permyakov in 2022 received Ukraine instructions about exploding the car of the writer Zakhar Prilepin and part of the money - two thousand rubles, after which he entered Russia through Latvia and committed an assassination attempt.It is alleged that correspondence with the elder was found on Permyakov‚Äôs phone operative SBU Zhuravkin, with whom Permyakov discussed -the preparation of a terrorist attack, surveillance of Prilepin and his houses, the placement of mines.- From a page on VKontakte under the name Ivanka Polikarpova, Zhuravkin communicated with Prilepin‚Äôs son Ignat and thus found out where the writer would be on the day of the terrorist attack. The prosecutor called the social danger of the crime colossal and noted -strong antisocial attitudes and socially dangerous interests- of the accused. At the same time, Permyakov‚Äôs sister Irina told the investigator during interrogation that while still a schoolchild, her brother was sentenced to 7 years because -he and his friends beat someone.- Four years later, he was released on parole, and in 2015 went -to the DPR militia.- In the spring of 2022, Permyakov moved to the Khmelnitsky region of Ukraine -as a migrant.-Prilepin himself refused to participate in the debate and asked that Permyakov be punished -in accordance with the law.- Permyakov did not speak out in the debate. Title: üñº The mayor of New York was charged with bribery for $100,000. H...
Description: The mayor of New York was charged with bribery for $100,000. He became the first sitting mayor of the city suspected of a criminal offenseThe US Attorney's Office on September 26 indicted the mayor of New York, representative Democratic Party Eric Adams is accused of receiving illegal campaign donations, as well as Turkey's influence on the election of Adams as head of the city, writes Reuters.Adams is charged with the following: - bribery;- two counts of extorting election contributions from foreign citizens;- organizing a fraudulent bank transfer scheme;- illegally receiving contributions from a foreign citizen for an election campaign.It is alleged that while still the head of Brooklyn, Adams traveled for free on a Turkish plane airlines on a trip costing tens of thousands of dollars, and for two nights in a luxurious suite at the St. Regis in Istanbul paid only $600, although he should have paid about $7,000.New York Federal Prosecutor Damian Williams said that the entire amount of the mayor's Turkish leisure, which included hotel stays, yacht excursions and flights business class, reached about $100,000, and Adams, according to Williams, -was required to declare- all expenses. Williams believes that in this way the Turkish authorities tried to gain the mayor's favor in order to later influence his decisions. In addition, Adams also partially financed his 2021 mayoral campaign in New York with donations from Turkey, receiving them through bogus American citizens. Adams, 64, denies wrongdoing and said he will fight the charges in court. He said he will not resign. -I will continue to do my job as mayor,- he said at a news conference in response to calls to resign.Adams, a former police officer, became the first of 110 mayors of New York who was charged with a criminal offense during his stay.

Title: üñº An installation dedicated to Stanislav Petrov, the man who pre...
Description: An installation dedicated to Stanislav Petrov, the man who prevented nuclear war, has appeared in St. PetersburgThe text reads: -The light of the sun's rays reflected from the clouds.- The work is dedicated to the event of 1983: While Petrov was on duty on the night of September 26, 1983, the missile attack warning system in the secret part of Serpukhov-15 in the Moscow region gave a signal - ballistic missiles were launched from US territory rockets. He could have given the order to launch an atomic strike on US territory, but Petrov decided that this was a false alarm of the system and passed the corresponding notification up the chain of command. After the investigation, it turned out that Soviet sensors mistook the light of the sun's rays reflected from the clouds for the launch of an American rocket. The day before, at a meeting of the Russian Security Council on nuclear deterrence, Vladimir Putin proposed to make changes to the doctrine of nuclear deterrence: -In the updated version of the document, aggression against Russia by any non-nuclear state, but with the participation or support nuclear state is proposed to be considered as their joint attack on Russia.-Photo: -Paper-

Description: The Norwegian Ministry of Internal Affairs has put a suspect in the sale on the wanted listpagers HezbollahAbout this reportsReuters. Title: üñº A Russian who fled from mobilization was denied political asyl...
Description: A Russian who fled from mobilization was denied political asylum in Norway. The country's authorities referred to Putin's words that the mobilization had ended Pavel Suetin left Severomorsk in the Murmansk region on September 22, 2022 - the day after the mobilization was announced. He came to Norway and requested asylum in the city of Vads√∏. However, in mid-September 2024, the Norwegian Migration Agency informed the man that he was not eligible for asylum and must leave the Schengen area within three weeks. This is the first known decision of this kind in Norway, writes The Barents Observer. According to the migration department, mobilization is not currently being carried out in Russia. Norwegian officials refer to the words of Vladimir Putin and Sergei Shoigu, who announced the completion of mobilization in October 2022. Suetin himself claims that the military commissariat continues to look for him even two years after the start of mobilization. According to the man, people from the military registration and enlistment office came to the apartment where he was registered and asked where he was. Suetin does not yet know what to do if the Norwegian authorities still force him to leave the country. -I'm sure, I know that I will be taken to war. I am of military age, I am not married, I have no children, I served in the army (although my military service consisted of removing snow and making the bed beautifully). Nowadays, it is not even necessary to serve a summons; it is enough to send it to the State Services - and the person is immediately deprived of the opportunity to leave the country. If I return to Russia, I will end up either in the army or in prison. Both options are tantamount to death.-Previously, Scandinavian countries have repeatedly refused political asylum to Russians. Thus, Russian Stanislav Brysin was refused asylum in Sweden, even despite his experience in holding protests and an open criminal case for -calls for terrorism.- At the beginning of the month, ASTRA wrote that in search of refuge, Brysin boarded a boat and sailed towards Ireland. Before this Sweden has deported a family from Belarus, against whom a criminal case has been opened in their homeland. The situation with shelters in the United States is no better. So, in material about American migration prisons ASTRA told the story of an opposition journalist from Russia with administrative punishment for -discrediting the army-, which US authorities deported to their homeland and handed over to the FSB.
